Isidra has received several loans from ODEF to invest in her business. She is now requesting a loan of 15,000 Lempiras [HNL] to buy materials such as iron, tin and nylon twine for making chairs. Her goal is to earn good profits and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials such as iron, tin and nylon twines to make chairs.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: julio de 59 años de edad vive con esposa en casa propia, Julio es un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y muy emprendedor, desde hace varios años se dedica a la  producción y venta de productos lácteos en la zona donde reside y también a la siembra de maiz y frijol. Tiene muy buena clientela ya que ha sabido ganarse la confianza de sus clientes. Ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, ha decidido invertir en el cuidado de sus ganados ya que de eso depende su negocio. Por eso ha solicitado un crédito para poder comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y  asi poder seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Julio, 59, lives with his wife in a house of their own. He is a hardworking, responsible and enterprising man, who has been producing and selling dairy products in the area where he lives for some years now. He also grows corn and beans. He has a good customer base due to his ability to gain people’s trust.

The quality and price of his products are good and he has decided to invest in his animals, which are the foundation of his business. This is why he has requested a loan to buy vitamins and concentrated feed. He will be able to continue improving his family’s quality of life, without limitations.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and concentrated feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: comprar calzado por mayor

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: Vicenta tiene 50 años de edad y se dedica al comercio de tienda. Es una mujer muy trabajadora quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para ganarse la vida y mantener la economía del hogar. Vicenta solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento y arena dado que desea repellar las paredes de la vivienda y no cuenta con el capital para hacer el desembolso pero si con la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.

loans.use: Para comprar: cemento y arena para repellar las paredes de la vivienda.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: elsa de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, su sobrina y sus dos hermanos, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta y elaboración de pupusas, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia posee mucha clientela por la higiene que tiene a la hora de preparar los alimentos y los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo ayuda en los gastos de su casa, Elsa esta solicitando un credito para la compra de los ingredientes necesarios como: quesillo, maiz, chicharrón, tomates, frijoles, repollos, etc. para seguir con su negocio y asi obtener mejores ganancias para seguir ayudando a su familia.

loans.use: comprar quesillo, maiz, chicharrón, tomates, frijoles, repollos, etc.

loans.name: Santos Aurelia

texts.es: Doña Santos,  tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene  4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Hace 15 años que estableció su propio negocio de  venta de comidas, pollo frito, tajadas, baleadas, tacos, y refrescos. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa.  Ha solicitado el cuarto ciclo de préstamo y es por 30,000 Lempiras, el cual lo invertirá en la compra de materia prima como carnes, arroz, vegetales, harina, manteca, condimentos etc. Para elaborar la comida y vender. Ella considera que esta inversión le va ayudar más a que su negocio siga creciendo, ya que su meta es ayudar a su familia.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima como carnes, arroz, vegetales, harina, manteca, condimentos etc. Para elaborar la comida y vender.

loans.name: Deyvir Javier

texts.es: Deyvir, tiene  37 años de edad, esta casado, tiene  3 hijos y vive en el municipio  de Choloma, Cortes. Se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general desde hace 8 años, vende ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.  También  vende materiales para confección de ropa interior como elásticos, tela para bóxer etc. Este negocio lo realiza de manera ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es el quinto ciclo en ODEF y es por 21,000 Lempiras, el que utilizara para comprar ropa nueva para poder incrementar el inventario y aumentar las ventas. Su plan es que el negocio crezca y que sus hijos tengan buena educación.

loans.use: Comprar ropa nueva en general para vender.

loans.name: Julia Elizabeth

texts.es: Julia de 32 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 9 años y 4 años de edad quienes se encuentran en edad escolar. Julia se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse al negocio por lo que ya cuenta en mucha experiencia y clientes que cada día la refieren más. Julia desea construir una pila con baño para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en  la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro.

loans.use: Para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para construir una pila con baño.

loans.name: Maria Marta

texts.es: Doña María, es madre soltera, tiene  3 hijos quienes ya son independientes y vive en la comunidad de Choloma, Cortes. Se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir como camisas de niño, pantalones cortos y faldas para damas.  Este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años y trabaja en su casa. Este negocio es su fuente de ingresos la que ha mantenido mediante la inversión de varios préstamos. Actualmente solicita el octavo ciclo y es por 7,000 Lempiras, ella va comprar telas, hilos, elásticos, botones y otros para confeccionar ropa. Su propósito es incrementar las ventas y las ganancias para poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Maria is a single mother who has 3 grown children who are already independent.  She lives in the community of Choloma, in Cortes.  Maria works as a dressmaker, making garments such as children's shirts, short pants, and women's skirts.  She's had this business for 10 years, and she works from her home.  This business is her source of income, and she's kept it going through investments made with various loans.  At this time, she is in her 8th loan cycle.  She's requesting a loan of 7,000 Honduran lempiras to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, and other dressmaking supplies.  Maria's goal is to increase her sales and earnings so she can make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy dressmaking supplies

loans.name: Yency Yohana

texts.es: Yency de 21 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 3 años de edad. Yency es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos de belleza desde hace tres años. Muchas personas la prefieren por que ofrece productos de buena calidad a muy buenos precios. Yency desea construir un cuarto en su terreno para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento ya que no cuenta con el capital para hacerlo por su cuenta pero si con la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Yency, 21, lives in her own home with her life partner and her 3 year-old child.  She is a very hardworking woman who's had a business selling clothing and beauty products for 3 years.  Many people prefer her business because she offers good quality products at very good prices.  

Yency wants to build a room on her property, and so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheets of corrugated metal, wood, and nails.  She hopes to be able to access these funds, because she lacks the capital to do this on her own.  However, she has the capacity to make the monthly payments on this loan.

loans.use: to buy building materials to add a room

loans.name: Maria Concepcio

texts.es: Doña María vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de venta de pupusas cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos de los gastos de su hogar. Cuenta con la satisfacción de tener clientela fija ya que esta ubicado en un lugar muy transitado. Doña Maria desea ampliar su puesto es decir comprar mesas, sillas, más materia prima como: maíz, frijoles, chicharrón, quesillo y todo lo necesario para su negocio y asi tener un poco  mas entrada económicamente, pero no cuenta con los suficientes ingresos para esta inversión, es por eso que se acercó a INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar lo dicho y así obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Maria lives with her husband and daughter in her own home.  She's had a business selling pupusas (a traditional Salvadoran dish made with a thick corn tortilla) near her home for a number of years.  With the earnings she gets from her sales, she is able to cover some of the household expenses.  

Maria has the satisfaction of having a regular clientele, because she’s located at a very busy place. She wants to expand her business by purchasing  tables, chairs, and raw materials like corn, beans, pork, cheese, and everything else she needs for her business so that her income will improve a bit.  However, she lacks the funds to make this investment.  This is why she approached INTEGRAL to request a loan to purchase the aforementioned items.  In this way, she will increase her earnings and have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, cheese, beans, corn, pork, etc.

loans.name: Gilma

texts.es:
Doña Gilma es una mujer de 46 años de edad, acompañada, y madre de 9 hijos de los cuales 7 de ellos viven bajo su mismo techo son menores de edad y los 2 mayores quienes estudian en secundaria y se involucran en los diferentes trabajos a desarrollar en el campo. Su fuente de ingresos depende del rubro del café ya que en la zona es la única fuente de ingresos con una experiencia de más de 15 años desarrollando esta actividad misma que fue inculcada por sus padres quienes también por generaciones y vocación han trabajado en el campo en dicha actividad. Su mercado son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona para revender el producto. Como desafío es este tipo de actividad es la alza de los precios en los diferentes insumos que son utilizados para asistir dicho producto así como también el cambio de precio de compra venta en el mercado ya que es inestable. La propiedad que trabaja con su familia es propia y está ubicada a 16 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitación al cual se traslada en autobús urbano que pasa por su comunidad.  
Sus metas, esperanzas y sueños mejorar su calidad de vida como ser la educación para sus hijos, cultivar una diversidad de cultivos para no solo depender de ese ingreso del café.
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes, abono, foliares y demás que ayuden a la protección de sus cultivos y desarrollo para que la próxima cosecha sea un éxito.
texts.en:
Gilma is a 46 year-old woman who is married and is the mother of 9 children.  Seven of them are minors and live under her roof.  The 2 older ones are in high school and are involved in various jobs working in the fields.  Gilma's source of income is growing coffee, because in this area this is the only source of income.  She has more than 15 years of experience in this line of work, which was taught to her by her parents.  For generations, her family has worked the fields growing coffee.

Gilma sells her products to the various distributors who arrive in her area to buy and then re-sell the product.  One challenge with this activity is the increase in the price of the various supplies that are needed to tend to the coffee crops.  Another challenge is when the purchase price of coffee varies in the market, because the price tends to be unstable.  Gilma works on land with her family that is their own property; it is located 16 kilometers distance from their home.  Gilma travels there on an urban bus that passes through her community.

Gilma's goals, hopes and dreams are to improve her quality of life, educate her children, and diversify her crops so that she is not only dependent upon coffee for her income.

At this time, Gilma is requesting a loan to buy organic and chemical fertilizers, leaf fertilizers, and other products to help protect and develop her crops so that her next harvest will be a success.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crops

loans.name: Sandra Lizeth

texts.es: Sandra, tiene 35 años  de edad, es casada, tiene  4 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella tiene su propio  negocio de una pulpería donde vende granos básicos, azúcar, sal, pan, verduras, pastillas de uso común, condimentos, jabón, manteca, huevos papel higiénico etc. este negocio lo tiene hace 10 años del cual a podido mantener a su familia. Ha solicitado el noveno ciclo de préstamo el  cual es por 13,000 lempiras, con este capital va poder surtir mejor la pulpería con productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, frijoles, refrescos, pan, verduras etc. Su meta es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Sandra, 35, is married and has 4 children.  She lives in the municipality of Choloma in Cortes, Honduras.  Sandra has her own grocery store where she sells staple consumer goods, sugar, salt, bread, vegetables, common over-the-counter pills, condiments, soap, butter, toilet paper, etc.  She's had this grocery store for 10 years, and with it she is able to support her family.  She is requesting her 9th loan for 13,000 Honduran lempiras to stock up her grocery store with products such as: rice, sugar, butter, beans, soft drinks, bread, vegetables, etc.  Sandra's goal is to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: Edison Israel

texts.es:
Edison  es un hombre de 22 años, soltero, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego  la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Ahora Edison  vive con sus padres en Pastocalle una parroquia del Cantón Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Pastocalle  está ubicado en el noroccidente de la provincia de Cotopaxi.
 En cuanto a su economía, es una zona agrícola y se sus habitantes se dedican a la elaboración del escobas y artículos de limpieza como cepillos, trapeadores etc, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. 
Edison  heredó de sus padres la habilidad para elaborar las escobas y otros artículos ,  un producto muy cotizado en la región Costa,  Edison  dedica a esta actividad desde 8 a 10 horas cada día Además a Edison  le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto. Edison agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en: Edison es un hombre de 22 años, soltero, gracias al esfuerzo de sus padres logró terminar la escuela primaria y luego la falta de recursos económicos lo llevó a trabajar desde muy chico para poder sustentar sus necesidades. A pesar de tener un trabajo que le demanda mucho tiempo y esfuerzo. Ahora Edison vive con sus padres en Pastocalle una parroquia del Cantón Latacunga ubicado en la Provincia de Cotopaxi en la República del Ecuador. Pastocalle está ubicado en el noroccidente de la provincia de Cotopaxi. En cuanto a su economía, es una zona agrícola y se sus habitantes se dedican a la elaboración del escobas y artículos de limpieza como cepillos, trapeadores etc, debido a su situación climática y geográfica, lo cual también produce efecto en las cosechas de las cuales se obtiene productos de la Región Sierra. Su gente vive al día a día de estas actividades, aunque es un lugar alejado de la ciudad, existen familias que han emprendido en todo tipo de actividades para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su comunidad. Edison heredó de sus padres la habilidad para elaborar las escobas y otros artículos , un producto muy cotizado en la región Costa, Edison dedica a esta actividad desde 8 a 10 horas cada día Además a Edison le gustaría en el futuro comprarse un vehículo que le permita llegar a más clientes que demandan el producto. Carlos agradece a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.

loans.use: Para elaboración del escobas y artículos de limpieza como cepillos, trapeadores etc

loans.name: Maria Dominga

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su hija y su esposo quien es empleado de una empresa. María se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas, posee mucha clientela ya que vende las mejores tortillas y calientitas, María trabaja de lunes a domingo cada mediodía y cada tarde, ella es una persona amable, responsable y muy dedicada a su hogar. ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar maíz por mayor y obtenerlo a precios más bajos, lo que le permitirá obtener más ganancias en sus ventas,y asi poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria, 34, lives in her own home with her daughter and her husband, who works for a company.  Maria has a business making and selling tortillas.  She has a lot of customers because she sells the best, piping hot tortillas.  Maria works every day at noontime and in the evening.  She is a kind and responsible person who is devoted to her household.  Maria is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy corn at wholesale to get the lowest price.  This will enable her to increase her profits from her sales, and thereby give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: María de 34 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 6 años y 2 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza desde hace dos años. Es muy trabajadora y responsable quien hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a sus hijos mejores condiciones de vida. Con el fin de darle mayor seguridad a su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas para la vivienda ya que las que tiene actualmente no son muy seguras.
texts.en: Maria, 34, lives in her own home with her life partner and their 2 children aged 6 and 2.  Maria's had a business selling beauty products for 2 years.  She is very hardworking and responsible, and she does everything she can to give her children better living conditions.  In order to give her family better security, she decided to request this loan from FUSAI to buy doors and windows for her home, because the ones she has now are not very secure.

loans.use: to buy doors and window for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, seeds, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Irvin Oswaldo

texts.es: Irvin tiene 23 años de edad y habita junto a sus padres y hermanos en casa familiar. Irvin trabaja como empleado en una empresa de transporte desde hace un año y es así como se gana la vida y colabora con la economía del hogar. Él desea ayudar a su familia con las mejoras de la vivienda y es por esta razón que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción del corredor de la vivienda para lo cual necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada y polines.
texts.en: Irvin, 23, lives with his parents and siblings in the family's home.  Irvin has been working for a transportation company for a year.  This is how he earns a living and contributes to the household finances.  Irvin wants to help his family to make some improvements to their home.  This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy materials to add a veranda to the house.  He will use these funds to buy construction materials such as sheets of corrugated metal and beams.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a veranda

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es: Cruz de 41 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hija y nieta. Ella posee un molino de nixtamal en el cual muchas personas llegan a moler variedad de semillas como: maíz, frijoles, arroz,etc. Además, posee una pequeña pupuseria (preparación alimenticia a base de masa de maíz, frijoles, queso, etc.) que le permite percibir otros ingresos que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para encementar el piso de la vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra.
texts.en:
Cruz, 41, lives in her own home with her daughter and granddaughter.  She has a mill where many people come to grind a variety of grains such as: corn, beans, rice, etc.  She also has a business selling pupusas (a traditional dish made out of cornmeal, beans, cheese, etc.)  This business allows her to earn additional income to help cover the household expenses.  

Cruz wants to improve the condition of her house, and so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, and gravel.  She wants to put a cement floor in her house, because currently it has an earthen floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to put a cement floor in her house

loans.name: Mercedes Pasion

texts.es:
Mercedes vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, desde hace 5 años trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de comida, especialmente desayunos, el cual inicio luego de mucho esfuerzo y sobre todo ahorro, con los ingresos de su pequeño negocio ha salido adelante y sobre todo a sus 4 hijos.

Mercedes esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar un carrito sanguchero, para poder elaborar salchipapas, hamburguesas, pollos broster, entre otros, de esta manera podrá tener mas platillos  para ofrecer y sobre todo poder mejorar y luchar para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in the city of Pucallpa.  For 5 years, she has worked in her small business selling food, particularly breakfasts.  She started this business with a lot of effort, and most of all, by saving her money.  With the income from this small business, she has been able to get ahead with her 4 children.

Mercedes is grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they are providing she will be able to buy a food cart so that she can make dishes such as: sausage and fried potatoes, hamburgers, roasted chicken, and other foods.  In this way, she will be able to have more dishes to offer her customers,  More importantly, she will be able to improve her business and strive to make her greatest dream a reality: "to give her children the opportunity to become professionals."

loans.use: to buy a food cart

loans.name: Gladys Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Gladys, tiene 39 años, es viuda desde agosto, tiene tres hijos una mayor de edad y dos de 13 y a15 años de edad y un nieto de dos años, vive en Puyo-Putuimi, dicha  zona es cálida- húmeda, es un sector con  variedad de vegetación, se dedica a la producción y venta de caña de azúcar (fruta) dicha actividad la realiza sola trabaja seis horas diarias todos los dias, el sueño de la señora fue ser profesora pero no tuvo el apoyo de sus padres y se caso a temprana edad y no pudo cumplir sus sueños, el propósito que tiene es mejorar su plantación con abono orgánico y una buena semilla de caña, para ofrecer a sus clientes producto de mejor calidad  e incrementar el ingresos para el estudio de sus hijos.
Gladys solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas y materia prima con el fin de mejorar su plantación y producir productos de calidad.
Gladys agradece a Fundación Alternativa y a Kiva por el apoyo recibido ya que gracias a estos fondos podrá cumplir sus metas a futuro.
texts.en: Gladys, 39, has been a widow since August. She has three children, one grown, and two who are 13 and 15 years old. She has a two-year-old grandson. She lives in Puyo-Putuimi, an area that is hot and humid. It's an area with a variety of vegetation. She works growing and selling sugar cane. She does this by herself and works six hours every day. Her dream was to be a teacher, but she didn't have her parents' support and got married at a young age, so she was not able to achieve her dreams. Her goal is to improve her field so she can offer her customers a higher-quality product and increase her income for her children's studies.

loans.use: Para la compra de semillas y materia prima con el fin de mejorar su plantación

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cheese, beans, corn, pork, soft drinks, tables, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 57 años de edad  vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro,  santos es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante,con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Santos quiere mejorar su vivienda y terminar de construir uno cuartos para sus hijos, por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro y pago de mano de obra y asi poder terminar la construcción para que el su familia puedan vivir mas cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
Santos, 57, lives with his life partner and his children.  He makes a living growing corn and beans.  He has been in agriculture for a long time, so he has a lot of experience in that field.

Santos is an enterprising man who very much wants to get ahead.  With what he earns from his sales he's able to cover some of the household expenses.

Santos wants to improve his home and finish building some rooms for his children, so he's requesting a loan to buy sand, cement, bricks, and rebar, and to pay for labor.  This way he can finish construction and he and his family can live with greater comfort and security.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, and rebar, and to pay for labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy soft drinks, soda, juice, water, etc.

loans.name: Yerly Gihovana

texts.es:
Buenos días ella es yerly Gihovana , se encuentra estudiando en la institución educativa campo alto en el programa salud oral y entra a tercer semestre, quisiera solicitar el convenio con kiva ya que el núcleo familiar de ella se encuentra en una situación económica favorable y las cuotas no nos quedan muy altas, ellas viven juntas en un apartamento en arriendo, el padre murió cuando ella estaba pequeña y desde entonces la mama se ha hecho cargo de ella en todos los aspectos económicos, incluyendo los estudios y todas las necesidades básicas.
La mama trabaja como una operaria en una empresa de confección y el sueldo que tiene no alcanza para sostener la comida, arriendo, servicios, quiere acceder al convenio ya que con esto podría culminar los estudios de una manera satisfactoria ya que a ella le toca aplazar el primer semestre de practicas ya que no contaba con los recursos necesarios y se presento una época difícil económicamente ya que la mama se quedo sin trabajo y a ella le toco buscar un trabajo personal en  un restaurante como mesera para poder suplir los gastos de la casa.
Actualmente ella se encuentra sin trabajo y la mama es la que le paga campo alto, espera graduarse para poder colaborar con lo que necesitan en su hogar y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Hoy agradezco la oportunidad que se le esta dando para los estudios, ya que han tenido situaciones que realmente le afectan, luego de la muerte del padre se han dedicado a salir adelante con la mama a pesar de las dificultades y los pormenores que se le han presentado a ella y su mama.
texts.en:
Good day meet Yerly Johana. She is studying at Campo Alto in the Oral Health program, entering her third semester. She wants to request a loan from Kiva as her family is in a favorable financial situation and the installment fees are not high. They live in a rented apartment. 

Her father died when she was small and since then her mother has taken charge of everything financial, including education and basic necessities. Her mother works as an operator in a sewing company. Her salary isn't high enough to pay their food, rent and services. So a loan from Kiva would allow her to finish her studies in a satisfactory manner as she postponed her first semester of practicum due to lack of financial resources. 

Her mother was without work and Yerly had to find work, in a restaurant as a waitress to help with the household expenses. Now Yerly is without work and her mother is who is paying for her studies at Campo Alto. She hopes to graduate to help earn what is needed for her family and enjoy a better quality of living. 

Yerly is grateful for this opportunity offered her to finish her studies. She has had experiences which really affect her. After the death of her father she has dedicated herself to helping her mother get ahead in spite of the difficulties and particulars that have befallen her and her mom.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.es:
Rossana trabaja en una Farmacia durante el dia y por la noche va a la facultad, vive con sus padres, es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder estudiar y salir adelante.
Comenta que su meta es trabajar en su profesión, seguir estudiando  y obtener mejores   ingresos para poder seguir ayudando a sus familias.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando y luchando por su meta.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, que le permitirá poder ayudar a las demás personas en su salud, lo cual siempre fue su sueño. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora, que se esfuerza por ser una profesional que pueda ser útil, no solo a sí misma, sino también a la sociedad.
Comenta que su sueño es poder terminar sus estudios y darle también una mejor vida a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir las cuotas de su universidad y de esa forma estar un paso más cerca de poder cumplir con su meta.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla es de la ciudad de Pilar, está cursando el último año de la carrera de Contabilidad, está empezando a elaborar su tesina, y espera culminar el año próximo y dedicarse a su profesión como contadora habilitando su propio estudio contable.
Ella pide su préstamo para poder invertirlo en la cuota de su universidad y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de seguir estudiando.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de universidad.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.en: Narciso is 36-years-old who cultivates a rice field.  He lives simply with his wife and three children.  He sacrifices his needs through working in the field because his family depends on him.  Narciso is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy four (4) bags of rice seeds, 24 bags of  fertilizers and six (6) liters of pesticides.  Having the additional capital he requested will be a great help in the improvement of his farming business.  He is sure to monitor and provide the needs of his crops to yield and harvest better crops in the next cropping season. Through this, he would be able to secure his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of rice seeds, 24 bags of  fertilizers and 6 liters of pesticides for his farming business

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
This is Noemi, 35, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jackson, a driver, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating the business. She and her husband work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Noemi maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands.  A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8, 000 loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Noemi dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to help her family financially. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Sokhom, 26, is a married mother of two children. 

The sources of her family’s income are rice farming and selling fish. She and her husband have been in these businesses for several years. Sometimes, they also work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about KHR 50,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sokhom is just with VisionFund for one cycle. She is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy more fish to resell and use a portion of it to spend on harvesting rice. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
To make a living, Mary Grace helps her husband in their fishing business. They have been doing this for more than nine years as their main source of income. She earns well from this, to provide for the family and she had successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative (GDMPC). She used her loan to purchase fishing materials. 

Currently, Mary Grace has taken a new loan  to buy new  machine of their fishing boat in order to improve her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy new  machine of their fishing boat

loans.name: Alofa

texts.en: Alofa is a 60-year-old woman who is married with twelve children. She has a small business, ice cake. She has two years with this business. Alofa needs a loan to buy a freezer, foam cups, cordial, chinese lollies and sugar. She will use her profits to improve her business. Alofa joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.(Please can you clarify more on this, because I'm confused I thought businesses are included in the stories}

loans.use: to buy a freezer, foam cups, cordial, chinese lollies and sugar

loans.name: Poutolu

texts.en: Poutolu is a 57-year-old single woman with 2 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, yams, and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 4 years. Poutolu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knives, weed killer, axes, and rakes. She has been a member of SBPD since 2009. With her profits, Poutolu hopes to improve her business to gain more money to support her family and her children.(Sorry member's correct age is 57 not 25).

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed killer, axes, rakes, etc.

loans.name: Etelani

texts.en:
Etelani is 55 years old and married with four children. She runs a small business selling Samoan coconut biscuits in her community and has been doing this for 3 years.

Etelani has requested a loan to buy flour, dripping oil, sugar, coconuts, baking powder, and plastic bags. She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Etelani will improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour, dripping oil, sugar, coconuts, baking powder and plastic bags

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita works hard to support her family. Teresita is married and has a candle-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Teresita requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like cord, wax, wire, etc. for her business. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like cord, wax, wire, etc. for her business

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.en: Stephanie, 25 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has operated a food vending business for almost one year, earning a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her profits are usually spent on school allowances for her children. Due to lack of capital, Stephanie would like to take out a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase vegetables and frozen foods to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business to earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Suraji

texts.en: Suraji is a new customer. He is 35 years old, married with four children and he trades coffee. He applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to improve his farming business. He has the challenge of low business turnover from his farming and low market purchases, so he decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to increase his manpower and expand both his farmland and his agriculture. In the photograph is Suraji (center), his wife and the UGAFODE credit officer.

loans.use: To hire manpower for his farm

loans.name: Tujinama Group

texts.fr:
Véronique fait partie du groupe  Tujinama  et habite à Gitega. Elle a 53 ans et est mariée à  Salvator, un agriculteur.Elle a sous sa charge ses deux petits enfants l'un a 16 ans et l'autre 17 ans.

Elle fait le commerce de  charbon de bois et de boutique depuis 9 ans.

Elle est à son vingtième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de sacs de charbon de bois  à revendre pour gagner plus.

Grâce aux gains de son commerce, elle parvient à satisfaire les besoins familiaux (se nourrir, se vêtir,…).

loans.use: elle  va  augmenter son capital et  beaucoup de sacs de charbon de bois  à revendre pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Uzuzanye Group

texts.fr:
Pascal  fait partie du groupe Uzuzanye  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 46 ans et est marié à  Godelieve,  une  cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants dont 4 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de boutique (bière, savon, riz, sel, …) depuis  10 ans. 

C'est son premier  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter  la quantité 
d’ articles ((bière, savon, riz, sel, …)  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

loans.use: il  va  augmenter  la quantité  d’ articles ((bière, savon, riz, sel, …)  à revendre, pour gagner plus.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en: Ani is a housewife living with three people in the family home in Bandung. Bandung is a major city in West Java, located about a two-hour drive from Jakarta. Ani runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits, mobile phone accessories, and processing bill payment for her customers. She joined Ruma because she wanted to expand her business. She is glad that her business is assisted and supported by Ruma agents. For the last three months, she has had around $30-$31 per day sales in average just from selling mobile phone airtime credits. She hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends when more people tend to come to her stall. In the future, she is planning to seek more business opportunities and put aside the extra income for his son's education. In the photo, Ani is sitting in front of her small stall. Ani thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru: Нигора живет на районе Спитамен. Ей 40 лет. Муж Нигоры находится за приделами страны. Он не нашел работу в родном районе и ему пришлось уехать чтобы прокормить семью. Нигора до сегодняшнего дня занималась мелкой торговлей. Она продавала детскую одежду и носки на рынке. Сейчас Нигора хочет открыть свой бизнес. Она решила заняться куплей и продажей скотов. Содержать скотов она будет в коровнике. Нигора планирует купить необходимое количество скотов и корма для них с помощью кредита, и начать бизнес. Она считается, что данный бизнес принесет хорошую прибыль, что способствует улучшению ее жилищных и жизненных условий.
texts.en: Nigora lives in the Spitamen district.  She is 40 years old.  Nigora's husband is outside the country.  He could not find work in his native district and had to leave in order to support the family.  To this day, Nigora was involved in small sales.  She sold children's clothing and socks at a market.  Now Nigora wants to open her own business.  She decided to get involved in reselling livestock.  She will keep livestock in a cowshed.  Nigora plans to buy a necessary number of livestock and feed for them with the help of this loan and start the business.  She thinks that this business will yield her a good profit, which will help to improve her living and life conditions.

loans.use: to buy livestock and feed in order to start her own business

loans.name: Wendbenedo Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKO ANNE est responsable du groupe WENDBENEDO. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 05ans.03 va à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits, chaussures et pagnes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les habitants du secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter  15 pièces de pagnes, 25paires de chaussures et 15douzaines d’habits pour enfants.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  réinvestir  dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle et mieux s’occuper  de sa famille.

loans.use: ’acheter  15 pièces de pagnes, 25paires de chaussures et 15douzaines d’habits pour enfants..

loans.name: Yamb Yel Benewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme  TENE  est responsable du groupe  YAMB YEL BENEWENDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgés à 10 ans. Les 03 vont  à l’école.
Mme  fait restauration (haricot) et vend de condiments depuis  10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes, hommes et enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter  03 sacs d’haricot, 02sac de riz et des condiments.	
Elle veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne s’acheter  un motocycle et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.

loans.use: s’acheter  03 sacs d’haricot, 02sac de riz et des condiments

loans.name: Krishna

texts.en:
Krishna, age 28 is a courageous lady from a village of Dhupguri. She lives with her husband, Bablu. They are illiterate and are only able to sign their names. 

Krishna’s husband has a small grocery shop. It was difficult for them to manage the minimum day-to-day expenses of the livelihood of her family, as the income from the grocery shop is very low. Krishna decided to expand her own grocery shop, but due to lack of funds, it was very difficult for them. Then she heard about BJS and decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a variety of groceries for her grocery shop.  

In the future, she dreams to extend her business and build a big concrete grocery shop with the profit from her business. She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for funding her without any hesitation.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба живет в отдаленном регионе. Она трудолюбивая женщина. Махбуба уже более 3 года занимается купле продажей целлофан. Она торгует на местном рынке. Махбуба сама справляется с бизнесом. Она является основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж не имеет собственного источника дохода. Махбуба хочет пополнить ассортимент своего товара, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки целлофан, чтобы пополнить ассортимент товара. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahbuba lives in a remote region. She is a hardworking woman. For three years, Mahbuba has been involved in buying and selling salafan. She trades at the local market. Mahbuba copes with the business by herself. She is the main breadwinner in the family, since her husband does not have his own source of income. Mahbuba wants to replenish her assortment of goods, but does not have money. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to purchase salafan, in order to replenish the range of goods.

loans.use: to buy cellophane for increasing working capital

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en:
Alfa is a woman of the age of 44 years. She lives in a small village, Baroghoria, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She is married to Akkel, who is 57 years old and a farmer by profession. Alfa lives happily with her husband and only son in their own house.

Alfa's husband and son both are engaged in cultivation of different seasonal vegetables on their ancestral land. Their agribusiness is the main source of income for the family. Alfa is also a wholehearted, good and industrious woman. She has an animal husbandry. She has a dairy cow, which gives milk every day, and she sells this to neighbours and friends. The income from this type of business is stable, but small. To lead a decent life, they have to earn more money. Therefore, Alfa wants to increase the number of cows so that she can increase the income from this business.

Alfa came to know about BJS and that they give loans to rural women to start businesses. She has taken a loan from BJS to purchase another cow and start a dairy products business (milk, butter, paneer, curd, etc.).  She hopes she will earn extra profit from this business, as the products are in huge demand in today's market.

She dreams to overcome the financial hurdles of their family and to purchase more cows with the profit, in order to expand her business.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to expand her existing milk-supply business.

loans.name: Tamina

texts.en:
Tamina is a 51-year-old widow from a small village, Baroghoria, in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is an uneducated woman and can only sign her name. She lost her husband few years ago. From then on, she has been working hard. 

She has been working as a daily labourer under a building contractor in order to look after her only son. Now her son is engaged in agriculture on their small piece of land. Tamina and her son live in their own small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo-made) with a lot of difficulties.

Tamina and her son work on their land from dawn to dusk and grow vegetables, which he sells in the local market. Both Tamina and her son do hard labour, but are unable to give sufficient sustenance to the family. They want to expand their agribusiness by cultivating potatoes, but for that they need some capital. Tamina is taking a loan to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers. She has chosen this business because there is a large demand for potatoes in her area, as well as throughout the West Bengal region.

She wishes to obtain financial sustenance through this business and give her son a better lifestyle. She wishes to employ some rural women to assist her in sowing and harvesting potato seeds, so that she can obtain good-quality potatoes to sell in the village market. 

Her dream is to buy a tractor for better cultivation in the future with the profit generated from this business.

She gladly thanks BJS and Kiva for the financial support.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is 22 years old, married, and raising two children (one son and one daughter) with her husband.  Haseena has an education of primary level, but her husband, Rashidul, aged 24 years, attended school up to grade 8.  Both their son and daughter are receiving education and read in grade 4 and grade 1 respectively. They live in their own house in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri .

Haseena 's husband is engaged in agriculture. He grows different vegetables in different seasons and sells them in the local market. For additional income, Haseena is involved in animal husbandry. In spite of the hard labour of Haseena and her husband, they are unable to cover all the necessary expenses incurred in their family, especially the educational expenses of their children.

In order to grow her business, Haseena has taken a loan to purchase a cow. She has decided to start a dairy products business (milk, paneer, cheese, etc.) and will sell the products in her neighbourhood. She hopes to earn much profit as the products are in great demand in the market.

Haseena plans to invest income from the loan to give a decent lifestyle to her family, to further grow the number of domestic animals, to save money for her children's education, and last but not the least, to build a concrete-made house for them.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow to start a milk and milk products business.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati, a 26-year-old housewife, lives in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband Haridas who is 28 years old.  They are blessed with two sons. Both their sons are school going and read in grade 4 and grade 6.  Malati and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign their names. She is a homemaker and her husband is engaged the business of making bamboo baskets. He sells the baskets in the local market.  His business is the only source of income for the family.  But he is not able to make sufficient income from his business.  They are very much concerned about their children's proper education and about earning their livelihood.

Now, Malati has decided to help her husband. She is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to purchase more bamboo to expand their business. They hope this will enable them to keep all the profits and improve the family's future.  Demand for this type of basket is high in their area. The high volume of work will create a steady income so that Malati can give her sons a bright future.

She aspires to upgrade their kachha house (bamboo, mud and straw made) to a concrete-made house, with the profit generated from this business.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more bamboo to make baskets

loans.name: Mamuda

texts.en:
Mamuda is a caring mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She is a 27-year-old housewife who is illiterate.  Her husband Abedul is also illiterate and is a farmer by profession. He is 31 years old and extensively engaged in cultivation to give a better lifestyle to his family. Their children are getting an education and are in grade 7 and grade 5.  They live in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri in their own small kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

Though Mamuda and her husband are illiterate, they are very much interested in educating their children and making them good citizens. Her daughter Ruksana, reading in grade 7, is a very intelligent student and her good performance in school inspires Mamuda to take a loan from BJS for her educational expenses. Her husband's inconsistent income makes them unable to go ahead with their daughter's education.

Mamuda took the loan to purchase Ruksana's text books, school uniform, pens, pencils, and other study materials and to pay the school fees, tuition fees, caution money (security deposit) and other necessary educational dealings.

Mamuda and her daughter (in the picture) are very much happy and grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding their educational loan.

loans.use: To pay school fees, tuition fees, and other educational expenses.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 40-year-old woman from the remote village of Jhumurpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is married to Bhabesh who is 45 years old and engaged in an agribusiness. Both of them completed their primary education. They are blessed with three school-going children (one son and two daughters), who are in grade 11, grade 8 and grade 5, respectively. They live in their own house.

One of her daughters, Madhabi, is in class VIII (grade 8).  Both Manati and her husband are very much concerned about their children's education. Their family expenses are increasing day by day and it is not possible for Minati's husband to meet all the expenses of the family with his small income. That's why some disputes have arisen about their children's education. As Madhabi possesses outstanding merit, she might score high in the annual examination. So to improve her educational skills and to give her proper private tuition, Minati is requesting an educational loan from BJS.  This loan will help Minati to provide her daughter with educational equipment such as books, notebooks, pens. pencils, geometry box etc, and to pay the school fees and private tuition fees, so that she can receive an education without any obstacles.

Madhabi, in the future, wants to be a schoolteacher, which she considers the most noble profession and this loan will help her to fulfill her dream.

Minati and Madhabi (in the picture ) are thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase educational supplies and to pay private tuition fees for her daughter

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 36 years old and lives in a remote region in West Bengal.  She lives in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She lives with her husband Robiul and their three children (one son and two daughters). All of the children are students. They are in grade 10, grade 11 and in college, respectively. They live in their own small kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made). Sakina has an education up to grade 6.  Her husband Robiul, age 40, has been a car driver for many years and his earnings are hardly enough to cover the educational expenses of their children after managing the household expenses. They want to give their children a higher education.

Her son Sahazad is now studying in grade 11 and very serious about his studies as well as his examinations. He makes himself busy with his studies all day long, as he has no private tutor.

Sakina heard about BJS and applied for a loan for her son's smooth education to make him a deserving student when he appears in the board exam.  She wants to pay the private tuition fees and buy the necessary supplies like books, notebooks, pens, pencils etc. to let Sahazad proceed a step further towards achieving good skills and knowledge. She wants her son to get a chance at the Joint Entrance Exam to become a doctor.

Sakina and her son (in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees and buy necessary supplies for her sons's education.

loans.name: Sakila

texts.en:
Sakila is a 38-year-old housewife who is uneducated and can only sign her name.  She is married to Taiyab, 47 years old, illiterate and engaged in a small business. They have three beautiful children (one son and two daughters). All of them are students. They live in the small village of Jhumurpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have a small house.

Her husband is engaged in a small business. His income is so scanty that he is unable to give sufficient financial sustenance to the family. The family expenses are increasing rapidly day by day against their income.  As a result, it has become impossible for him to pay the educational expenses of their children, so they are thinking of discontinuing their education.

Sakila’s daughter Taslima is a student in grade 9.  She is a very brilliant and studious girl. If she could have private tuition or coaching, then she would do much better in her final exam. All the teachers at her school are waiting for her outstanding results in the final exam. Sakila has taken the loan from BJS to support her daughter's education.  The loan would help her to purchase educational supplies like books, notebooks, pens, pencils, geometry box etc. and to pay the fees for school and for the private tutor.

Sakila and her daughter (in the photo) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies and pay school fees and private tuition fees.

loans.name: Maleka

texts.en:
Maleka is 38 years old.  She is a woman from the remote village of Jhumurpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a housewife and uneducated. She can only sign her name. Her husband Rafikul, age 47, is engaged in a small business. He is also illiterate. They are blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). Maleka and her husband are providing an education for them.  They are in grade 9, grade 5 and grade 4, respectively.  They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

They are willing to provide her children with a higher education and desire that they do not face any obstacles in receiving this education.

Maleka's husband has been associated with a small business for many years.  His earnings are hardly sufficient to cover the educational expenses of their children after meeting the household expenses of the family.

Maleka's daughter Rokeya is now studying in grade 9 and very much serious about her studies. She aims to be a doctor in the future.

Maleka learned about BJS and applied for a loan for her daughter's uninterrupted education. With the loan, will pay the private tuition fees and school fees and buy supplies like books, notebooks, pens, pencils, geometry box etc. for educational purposes for her daughter.

Maleka and her daughter (in the photo) are very glad and obliged to Kiva and BJS for this loan. They give hearty thanks to them.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees and purchase educational supplies for her daughter.

loans.name: Rolandi

texts.en: Rolandi is a repeat borrower located in Rwensinga Rukanga Nyabihoko, Ntungamo district and has applied for loan of 2,000,000 UGX.  He wants to use the money to improve his coffee plantation through mulching it; he has a challenge of low productivity within his farming businesses due to poor farming methods.  His prime target is to yield high output from his plantations, and to take his children to better schools in the country.  He is limited by capital and funds to enable him to achieve his dreams.  With this loan he believes his production will improve and his lifestyle will change in the society.  Pictured is Rolandi with the UGAFODE credit officer(right to left)

loans.use: To buy mulch

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 34 year old male, a local council leader who lives together with his children and wife.  Joseph has witnessed the increase in the price of charcoal and most important the effect this source of energy has had on the environment. 

Joseph says that if nothing is done on the source of energy for cooking, Uganda might become a desert and “this is not good for our environment”. 

Joseph was aware bout the existence of Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) as an alternative energy, however his problem with LPG has been the existing myth which people say it is a “bomb”. However with information availed to him by WANA, he realized that LPG is the absolute replacement of charcoal. Joseph is very grateful to the KIVA saying that had it not been this loan probably he wouldn’t have ever heard about the existing alternatives to charcoal and firewood.

loans.use: To pay for liquefied petroleum gas as an alternative energy in order to preserve the environment

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a primary school science teacher. He is 44 years old, married with children. Deo use a combination of charcoal and firewood for cooking at his home. Deo is aware about the impact of cutting trees to the environment, hence pushing high the cost of living because of draught.

Deo is grateful that there are some alternative sources of energy such as Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) which can replace charcoal and firewood. 

Deo said that because of the size of his family, he wouldn’t have ever thought of buying LPG due to its high initial costs involved. He says had it not been the KIVA loan he wouldn’t have ever been able to access cooking gas. He is grateful that he is now part of the communities which are switching to LPG in order to reduce on the impact of firewood and charcoal has on the environment.

loans.use: To pay for a liquefied petroleum gas package in order to save the environment

loans.name: Mamahawa

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Mamahawa from Kandeh town Bo. She is married with seven children between the ages of two years and 19 years. Five of her children currently attend school. 

Mamahawa runs a cookery business, she sells cooked food. She has been running this business for 10 years. She works at the business throughout the week from 4:30AM, she will not rest unit the food is finished. Her business is the only source of income she has. Mamahawa says that her business is doing well; she usually has new customers every day.

Mamahawa has requested a loan in order to purchase more fish,rice, palm oil and cooking season to expand her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and change her living conditions. In the future, she plans to build a house. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish,rice, palm oil and cooking season to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Isis Fabiola

texts.es:
Isis de 40 años de edad es una mujer que se dedica a la producción de papaya y plátano con una experiencia de cultivo de más de 8 años de cultivar entre hortalizas y frutales. Tiene un grado de estudio de secundaria completa madre de 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad y estudian en primaria en el instituto de la comunidad. Su esposo apoya todas y cada una de las actividades emprendidas ya que el lleva la parte del comercio y juntos se complementan formando un equipo llevando ella la administración y supervisión den el campo. Su mercado meta principal para este producto son los diferentes intermediarios que llegan a la zona desde las principales ciudades de nuestro país (San Pedro Sula y Tegucigalpa) ya que su negocio está situado en medio de ambas ciudades agregando que su producto es muy cotizado por los precios accesibles, calidad y consistencia.  
Sus metas mejorar su calidad de vida como ser la educación para sus hijos, el crecimiento de cultivar diversidad de cultivos en su propiedad para no solo de pender de ese ingreso, etc.
Por lo que Isis hoy día solicita para la compra de  insumos, fertilizantes y plantas de papaya para poder cultivar y extender sus cultivos ya que con el apoyo del este financiamiento ella podrá resolver sus necesidades de atender sus cultivos para brindar la asistencia técnica que los mismos necesitan.

loans.use: para la compra de insumos agrícolas y plantas de papaya para asistir y cultivar

loans.name: Emma

texts.es:
Emma es profesora en área urbana, tiene un hijo, actualmente viven en la casa de sus padres, en donde tienen una habitación con piso de tierra en la ciudad de El Alto. Tienen una casita  propia la cual está refaccionando,y justamente el crédito que solicita lo requiere para compra de cemento y estuco para continuar la refacción.

El sueño de Emma es contar con un domicilio en condiciones de buena habitabilidad para confort de su familia.

Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito  en IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA
texts.en:
Emma is a teacher in an urban area. She has a son, with whom she is currently living in her parents' house. There, mother and son have a room with a floor made of earth in the city of El Alto. Emma has her own little house, which is currently being done up. She is applying for a this loan in order to buy cement and plaster in order to continue with the building work.

Emma's dream is to have a good house for her family to live comfortably.

This is the first time that Emma has applied for a loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy cement and plaster in order to continue doing up her house and to be able to move in to it.

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra, vive en casa propia con su esposo e hijos en la zona de tacagua, de la ciudad de la Paz, actualmente se dedica a la confeccion de chamarras y chalecos, segun el pedido que le hagan, realiza esta actividad con ayuda de su hijo quien se encarga de obtener los contratos. Ella usa maquinas industriales a pedal, la tela que recicla la usa para la elaboracion de almohadas, ella no desperdicia nada del material que usa y tampoco contamina el medio ambiente.

El credito que solicita es para concluir con la construccion de su vivienda, la misma que era de adobe y ahora es de ladrillo, el taller que tiene para su negocio ya es mas grande por lo cual esta mas limpio y todo esta acomodado. Necesita comprar madera para los pisos y pinturas y ventanas.

El sueño de Alejandra es terminar con la construccion de su vivienda.tener un taller y dar trabajo a otras personas que lo necesiten.
texts.en:
Alejandra lives in her own house with her husband and children in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz. She currently works making jackets and pullovers to order. She does this work with the help of her son, who is responsible for finding customers. Alejandra uses industrial pedal machines and recycles material in order to make pillows. Alejandra does not waste any of the material she uses and is also not polluting the environment.

This loan will be used to finish building her home. It was made with adobe bricks but now is made with bricks. The workshop that Alejandra has for her business is now bigger and cleaner, and everything is set up for her work. Alejandra needs to buy wood for the floors, and paint and windows.

Alejandra's dream is to finishing building her home, to have a workshop and to give other people work.

loans.use: to buy wood for the floors, and paint and windows in order to finish building her house.

loans.name: Maria Florinda

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 38 años de edad se dedica a la producción de café desde hace muchos años así como también a la producción de granos básicos para el consumo de su familia. Su grado de estudio es de primaria completo que gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres pudo terminar pero por la falta de dinero ella no pudo seguir estudiando ya que su familia es económicamente humilde. Ella tiene 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad y actualmente estudian en primaria siendo su esposo su único apoyo para llevar a cabo las diferentes actividades que en el campo se desarrollan como la limpieza, recolección del grano al final de la cosecha, aplicación de abono, entre otras que son necesarias para la protección, cuidado del grano y su desarrollo. 
Sus metas mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, cultivar diversidad de granos en su propiedad para no solo depender de un mismo ingreso, apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios para que ellos se conviertan en profesionales y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Por lo que hoy en día Doña María solicita a la cooperativa COMIXMUL apoyo financiero para llevar a cabo la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayuden a proteger sus cultivos de café ya que la economía de su hogar depende de este rubro por lo que tiene que dar una excelente asistencia técnica para poder al final de la temporada obtener un grano con calidad.

loans.use: para la compra de insumos agrícolas y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos de cafe

loans.name: Sababsongo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme WOUGO MARGUERITE représente le groupe SABABSONGO 2. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 09enfants. Le plus âgé a27ans et le moins âgé a 1an. 07 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des tubercules et fruits depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo et au Ghana. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter 30sacs d’ignames.
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un magasin de stockage de tubercules et fruits et mieux s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants.

loans.use: s’acheter 30sacs d’ignames.

loans.name: Enma Zulema

texts.es:
Enma Zulema es una joven con 28 años de edad la cual tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleta cursado hasta el 4 año ya que por la falta de apoyo financiero por parte de sus padres quienes son de escasos recursos no pudo terminar sus estudios. Ella es ama de casa y agricultora madre de 4 hijos quienes son menores de edad, en un estado civil de unión libre siendo su compañero de hogar quien más se involucre en las diferentes actividades de campo ya que ella solo se involucra en ocasiones y para la recolecta del grano al final de la temporada, mientras llega ese tiempo ella se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y cuidado de sus hijos. Su cliente principal es la Cooperativa del Café quien evalúa y compra el grano a muy buen precio ayudando de esta manera a mejorar la calidad de vida de sus clientes y valorando arduo y pesado trabajo que se lleva a cabo en el desarrollo de estas actividades. Sus cultivos de café están ubicados a 2 Kilómetros de distancia desde su casa de habitación a la cual se dirigen caminando.  
Sus metas dar a sus hijos un mejor porvenir, mejorar su calidad de vida y enseñarles valores y principios que ayuden a ser mejores personas en la vida, así como también enseñarles el trabajo de campo ya que si en algún día ellos deciden trabajar y no estudiar que sepan cómo desarrollarlo y llevar a cabo los procesos para obtener una excelente producción al final de cada temporada.  
Por lo que hoy en día ella solicita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a dar a sus cultivos la protección y fortalecimiento que ayudara a que el grano se encuentre protegido de heladas y la planta de plagas que puedan dañaras.

loans.use: para la compra de insumos agrícolas para asistir sus cultivos de café

loans.name: Susana Herlinda

texts.es: Susana de 30 años de edad habita en casa propia junto  a su esposo y sus dos hijas de 6 y dos años de edad. Susana se dedica a la prestación de servicios y además tiene una pequeña tienda en la cual vende variedad de artículos de primera necesidad. Ella desea mejorar las condiciones del techo de la vivienda ya que cuando llueve se filtra el agua. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y nueva teja para asegurar la cubierta del techo.

loans.use: Para comprar: lámina galvanizada y nueva teja para asegurar la cubierta del techo.

loans.name: Roxana Katherinne

texts.es: Roxana de 22 años de edad habita en casa propia y trabaja como empleada en una empresa cercana a su localidad. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Roxana desea mejorar el techo de la vivienda ya que el que actualmente tiene se encuentre deteriorado. Roxana solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra lámina galvanizada, madera y teja para proceder a cambiar el techo lo antes posible.

loans.use: Para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera y teja para proceder a cambiar el techo de la vivienda  lo antes posible.

loans.name: Rosa Alicia

texts.es: Rosa de 49 años de dad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y le colaboran con la economía del hogar. Rosa se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz desde hace 10 años por lo que ya cuenta con mucha experiencia y muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Rosa desea hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda como ampliar el corredor, techarlo y encementarlo por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, cemento, arena, grava y una puerta  para la entrada de la vivienda.
texts.en: Rosa, who is 49 years old, lives in her own home with her husband and her adult children, who contribute to the household economy. Rosa has been working buying and selling corn for ten years, so she has a lot of experience and many customers who prefer her more and more every day. Rosa wants to make some improvements on her home, like widening the corridor, as well as roofing and cementing it. That is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. She will invest in purchasing sheet metal, cement, sand, gravel, and a new front door.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, cement, sand, gravel, and a new front door to improve her home.

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es: William de 30 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 7 años de edad y su hija de 2 años de edad. William trabaja en un taller de mecánica en el cual recibe un ingreso mensual que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar. Él desea mejorar el techo y la pared interna de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizad y madera para proceder lo antes posible a la mejora del techo y la pared interna.
texts.en:
William, who is thirty years old, lives in his own home with his life partner and their son and daughter, who are ages two and seven. William works for a car repair shop, from where he earns the monthly income that allows him to provide for his family. 

He wants to improve the roof and the inside of the walls in his home, which is why he is requesting this loan from FUSAI. He will invest in purchasing sheet metal and wood in order to start the improvements to the roof and interior walls as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal and wood to improve the roof and the inside of the walls of his home.

loans.name: Froilan De Jesus

texts.es: Froilan tiene 36 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijas de 3 años, 12 años, 7 años y sus dos hijos de 8 años y 2 años de edad. Él trabaja como ganadero desde hace mucho tiempo tiempo y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Froilan solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del piso de la vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena y grava para reparar el piso de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Froilan is 36 years old and lives in his own home with his life partner and their children. They have three girls, who are three, twelve, and seven years old, and two boys, who are eight and two. He has worked as a cattle rancher for many years, so that is how he provides for his family and gives them better living conditions. 

Froilan is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in improving the floor of the home, which is in disrepair. He will use the requested amount to buy cement, sand, and gravel in order to repair the floor of his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel to repair the floor in his home.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: A sus 73 años de edad Santiago trabaja como jornalero y además se dedica a la comercialización de arena. Es un hombre muy trabajador  ya que hace todo lo que este a su alcance para dar a su familia mejores condiciones. Santiago habita en casa propia junto a compañera de vida y sus hijos y desea invertir en la construcción de dos paredes para construir un cuarto dentro de la vivienda. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en los materiales necesarios como: ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para la construcción.
texts.en:
At his 73 years of age, Santiago works as a laborer and also selling sand. He is a very hard worker, and does everything that is in his power to give his family better living standards. 

Santiago lives in his own home with his life partner and their children, and he wants to invest in building two walls to create a new room in his house. He is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the materials he needs for the project, like bricks, sand, and iron.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Maria Natalia

texts.es: María de 56 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su madre y un hijo de 20 años de edad. María es una mujer muy admirable quien ha trabajado toda su vida para mantener a su familia y llevar el pan de cada día. Trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace 2 años y de esta forma mantiene la economía al hogar. María desea invertir en la instalación del agua potable en su hogar dado que no cuenta con el servicio. En vista que no cuenta con el capital disponible para el desembolso solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de agua potable y así mejor sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María, who is 56 years old, lives in her own home with her mother and a twenty-year-old son. María is a very admirable woman who has worked her whole life in order to support her family and provide for them. She has been working as a domestic for two years, which is how she is supporting her household economy. 

María wants to invest in installing potable water in her home, because she doesn't have this srevice currently. Since she doesn't have enough available capital for the expense, she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in installing potable water utilities and improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to connect to potable water utilities.

loans.name: Tano Group

texts.es: Grupo conformado por tres socios emprendedores de éxitos uno de ellos es Estanislao hombre de 65 años de edad, acompañado, con un hijo bajo su responsabilidad, se dedica a sembrar maíz y pipían y también  trabaja como transportistas desde hace 8 años. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de abono, semillas mejoradas  de maíz, semillas mejoradas  de pipían,compra de insecticidas , fertilizantes, preparacion de la tierra, pago de mozo. Marbelline tiene 26 años su negocio es la venta de tortillas y nacatamales, Teresa mujer de 36 años su negocio es la venta de pinol y pinolillo.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three successful entrepreneurs, one of whom is Estanislao. He is 65 years old and has a spouse and one son under his care. He grows corn and pumpkins. He has also worked as a driver for eight years.
